page.title: 10VILLAGE SCHOOL INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: Education for children up to the age of 11 years is provided at Ince Blundell R.C. Primary School. The school was built in 1843. The school was endowed and the land given by the Weld-Blundell family.It was built by Martin Billington. The school is built of large sandstone blocks with a tiled roof(not part of the original building).There are two classrooms and a dining/resourse area. The headteacher is assisted by two part-time assistant teachers. Most of the children live in the village.Although the school is a Voluntary Aided Roman Catholic school, almost half the children are of other denominations.At this time there are 25 children on roll.
